de.wwu.muggl.vm.initialization
Class FieldContainer

java.lang.Object
  de.wwu.muggl.vm.initialization.FieldContainer
Direct Known Subclasses:
InitializedClass, Objectref
public abstract class FieldContainer
extends java.lang.Object

This abstract class is a container for fields; it offers a Hashtable that stores instances of Field as well as their corresponding values. If also offers the functionality to get values from fields and to put values to fields.

It is extends by the concrete classes InitializedClass and Objectref; the first offers access to static fields (and is responsible for the instructions getstatic and putstatic), while the second one offers access to instance fields (and is responsible for the instructions getfield and putfield).

For getting fields, lazy initialization is implemented. When statically initializing a class only those static fields are initialized that are explicitly put in the static initializer (the <clinit> method). The same applies for instance initialization: Only those fields are initialized that are explicitly put in the instance initializer (constructor, the chosen <init%gt; method). As a consequence, fields that have not been initialized yet might be accessed during the execution of a program. In that case, the accessed value will simply be initialized to its default value. This might lead to some overhead at runtime, it still is overall faster and less memory-consuming than statically initializing all fields to their default values.

Version:
1.0.0, 2010-07-15
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

Parameters:

Returns:

Throws:
FieldAccessError - If the Field does not belong to the Class represented by this InitializedClass.

hasValueFor

public boolean hasValueFor(Field field)
Check whether there is a value stored for the specified field.

Parameters:
field - The field to check.
Returns:
true, if there is a value for the field, false otherwise.
